cut back.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to reduce the amount, size, cost etc of something
cut back.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Several major hospitals are cutting back on staff at the moment.
Education spending cannot be cut back any further.
Richer countries must do more to cut back carbon emissions.
cut back.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to remove the top part of a plant in order to help it to grow
cut back.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Cut back the shoots in spring to encourage bushier growth.
cut back.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to eat, drink, or use less of something, especially in order to improve your health
cut back.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Try to cut back on foods containing wheat and dairy products.
